sentences.en: Dissent used to be strong in this part of England.
sentences.cn: 在英国的这一地方过去曾激烈反对国教.

sentences.en: He felt her shoulders gave a wriggle of dissent.
sentences.cn: 他感到她的肩膀因为不同意而动了一下.

sentences.en: He felt her shoulders give a wriggle of dissent.
sentences.cn: 他觉出她的肩膀扭动一下,表示她的反对.

sentences.en: He tossed his head to show his dissent.
He was an honest man, oppressed by the inroads of dissent.
sentences.cn: 他是个诚实的人, 为不信教者的侵蚀所苦恼.

sentences.en: I made a gesture of dissent.
sentences.cn: 我做了个表示不同意的手势。

sentences.en: In those days , religious dissent was not tolerated.
sentences.cn: 那年头不容许对宗教信仰持异议.

sentences.en: It is too late now to make any dissent.
Justice Brennan filed a strong dissent.
sentences.cn: 布伦南法官持有强烈的异议.

sentences.en: Political dissent would no longer be tolerated.
sentences.cn: 政见不和将不再被容忍。

sentences.en: She was surprised to hear Tom dissent. She could not understand it.
sentences.cn: 汤姆不同意,这让贝基大吃一惊, 不能理解.

sentences.en: There are some dissenting voices (= people who do not agree ) among the undergraduates.
sentences.cn: 大学生中有一些反对的呼声。

sentences.en: This push will cheer me ever or dissent me now.
sentences.cn: 我的成败完全赖此一举了.

sentences.en: Today's council sessions have been carefully stage-managed to avoid embarrassing disclosures or signs of internal dissent.
sentences.cn: 今天的理事会会议已经过精心安排，以避免爆出令人难堪的讯息或显示出内部不和的迹象。
两名陪审团成员表示了异议。

words.tran_cn: 反对的，持异议的；不赞成的

trans.tran_en: refusal to agree with an official decision or accepted opinion
to say that you disagree with an official decision or accepted opinion
a statement by a judge giving their reasons for disagreeing with the other judges in a law case
to say that you disagree with an official decision or accepted opinion
